intro: Heterotoma lobelioides var. tonelii, commonly known as the Tonelli's heterotoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically display shades of blue or violet. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
